result.execSummary:
The defendant Denise J. Varboncoeur was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reminder Notice - Not Deliverable As Addressed, Unable to Forward - Deceased

ADDRESS INFO for Denise J. Varboncoeur
Current: 975 W Seminary St Apt 241, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 07-25-2016)
Prior: 975 W. Seminary St., Apt. 241, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States
Concerning Attorney Fees (submitted to Accts. Payable this date; Def was previously Court-ordered to repay Richland County the costs of this counsel; reimbursement asst entered in 14CM144)

Several cases called together:  14CM144 and 15CM8/sentencing after revocation matters with appearances by Defendant Denise J. Varboncoeur in court with attorney Brian Walter Gleason; Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  15CM139, 15CM140, 15CM227, 15CT40, and 16CF47 called together for plea/sentencing with appears by Defendant with attorney Michael Curran; DA Harper for the State.

In the revocation matters, Atty. G argues to the Court re what he believes were deficiencies in the revocation process.

Atty. C suggests that all matters be rescheduled or at least recalled later today.

Matters recalled:

DA Harper recites plea agreement of the parties in the non-revocation cases.

Def pleads guilty to Count 1 in 15CM139 (theft), Count 1 in 15CM140 (concealed weapon), Count 1 in 15CT40 (OWI 2nd), and amended Count 1, Count 2, and Count 3 (drug charge and bail jumping charges) in 16CF47.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Count 1 in 16CF47 amended to 961.573 (1).

Sentences:

15CM139 - Count 1 - 6 months county jail, imposed/stayed for 3 years probation with conditions to include restitution of $2461 to Greenway Manor; if restitution not paid, civil judgment could be ordered; Defense has 30 days to file any challenge to the restitution.  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any educational or treatment programs ordered by agent; complete AODA and follow through with recommendations of counselor; pay costs of the action.

15CM140 - 3 months county jail, consecutive to the 6 months in 15CM139, imposed/stayed for 3 years probation.  Costs. Same conditions of probation.

15CT40 - OWI 2nd - $1429, 10 days jail, 12 mo revocation, 12 mo IID, $69 for blood draw.  Jail is consecutive to any other time def is serving.

16CF47 - Count 1/possession - 30 days jail imposed/stayed for 3 years probation with same terms, along with costs.  Counts 2 and 3 - 3 months county jai each count, imposed/stayed, consecutive, for 3 years probation with same conditions and costs.

15CM227 - dismissed/read-in.  All other counts dismissed/read-in.

Def and Atty. Gleason addresses the Court prior to sentencing after revocation in 14CM144 and 15CM8.

Sentences:

Court orders AODA but does not order ARC. 

6 months county jail on all revoked counts, concurrent, with credit for 136 days.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Curran re. scheduling
Status conference on May 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Telephone request from Atty Curran re. rescheduling from 05/10/16 to 05/17/16. No objection by DA.
Status conference on May 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on May 3, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Atty. Curran, who represents def in open/pending matters and who appears with her this date in those matters, requests that def be considered for Dean counsel in the upcoming probation revocation proceedings (proceedings are on 4/26) in this matter; def does not qualify for SPD.  Defendant Denise J. Varboncoeur in court, in custody.  Court appoints Atty. Brian Gleason to represent def during the probation revocation proceedings.  Def to repay Richland County for all costs of counsel - $50/mo.

ADDRESS INFO for Denise J. Varboncoeur
Current: 975 W. Seminary St., Apt. 241, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 08-26-2015)

ADDRESS INFO for Denise J. Varboncoeur
Current: 975 W. Seminary, Apt. 251, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 08-07-2015)
Prior: 419 S Sheldon, Richland Center, WI 53581

Defendant Denise J. Varboncoeur in court with attorney Michael C. Curran. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases called together:  14CM144, 15CM8, 14TR1368, and 14TR1446; also two unfiled cases.  DA states State has filed an amended complaint in 15CM8 for four counts.  Per DA, parties have an agreement for resolution of all matters.  DA states the agreement calls for def's pleas to all four counts in 15CM8, as well as to an amended charge of mis. bail jumping in 14CM144 and plea to OWI 1st in 14TR1368.

Per DA, recommendation for sentence on the five misdemeanors in the two criminal cases is 3 years probation with conditions of AODA and treatment at recommendation of agent.  In 14TR1368, asking for $66 blood draw along with $761.50, 6 mo rev, aoda/driver safety plan for relicensing.  All other cases to be dismissed (no pros on the two unfiled cases and dismissal of 14TR1446).

Def pleads no contest to the five misdemeanors and guilty to the OWI 1st charge.  Court's colloquy on pleas in the misdemeanor cases.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence withheld for 3 years probation with conditions that def attend, pay for, and succ. complete any treatment or educational programs ordered by agent; aoda/follow through with recommendation; pay costs; stop at RCSD to submit DNA sample.

14TR1368 - $761.50 plus $66 blood draw cost, 6 mo revocation, AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed.  Def asks clerk to take the money due for this matter from the bond that she had posted in the two unfiled matters.

14TR1446 ordered dismissed.

10 days credit on 15CM8.
Status conference at 04-22-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Denise J. Varboncoeur in court with attorney Michael C. Curran. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Status in 14CM144, 14TR1368, 14TR1446, and initial in 15CM8.  Initial appearance completed in 15CM8 with formal reading waived by def, charges and max. penalties stated by the Court, and entry of NG pleas on def's behalf, def having stood mute.  Further status requested and set in all matters for April 22 at 9.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
